We upgraded some of our choices knowing it would be more expensive, but it still didn't make for an enjoyable evening.

The locations in NC are set up so no booth is right across from another booth, they are kind of staggered for privacy, here felt like we were eating at TGI Fridays. The couple that was set directly across from us had requested a more private table that could not be accommodated and they made a scene. Uncomfortable, to say the least and not the date night I had in mind.

You better be a fan of garlic to eat here, because aside from the dessert, it's in every choice of every course and something about a plate of raw meat and seafood being set down in front of you, with instructions of how long to let it "cook" as in- if it walks boil two minutes, if it swims boil a minute and  1/2, is less than appetizing. 

Our total bill came to $180 (before the $75 credit or tip) and we left disappointed, vowing to never return. Our Living Social Deal also listed we would be given a complimentary champagne toast, which we were not even offered.  I get that we purchased a "coupon" but shouldn't be limited to a certain menu or treated any differently from other patrons in the restaurant.  

This place was not worth the 3 hours we spent there, "deal" or not.

The hubby took me here for a date night. The ambiance is great, and it is fun to watch your food cook and coordinate the various meal options with your date. That being said the food is just okay for me. My husband always says it is about the experience and I would tend to agree with him. 

Next time I think we will just experience the s'mores fondue and skip the rest. Much easier on the pocketbook that way. 

I do recommend joining Club Fondue as about three times a year we get free chocolate fondue for two which is probably the best part.

Came here with my sister and brother in law for New Year's Eve. What a wonderful decision. We had 7pm reservations and it was nice to arrive and be seated immediately. The place was busy, but very well organized. The food is good, but I have to say it's the overall experience that earns the five stars. Tonight, that experience was facilitated by a very delightful server by the name of Lisa. We had the French onion cheese fondue for starters, I had a Caesar salad. The pine nuts are wonderful, I think they were candied, which added a great sweet and savory component. We went with the coque vin (sp?). It is really a great broth for the entree. We did the cuts and added a couple lobster tails. All wonderful. Then dessert. Oh my yum. We went with the snicker doodle which was chocolate, peanuts, butterscotch schnapps, and baileys. Wow. As if we weren't already full. It was like we were addicts and couldn't stop. Until we realized if we kept going it wasn't going to be pretty. The meal included champagne toast and they gave us each a swag bag which included their wonderful wine salt and a voucher for $25! They also took our picture and we each got a framed copy as a momento. I was very impressed. Usually I like to go all out for New Year's Eve and go out and hit up a party scene. This year I wanted something low key with family and The Melting Pot gave 2012 the perfect send off. I want to give a special thanks to Lisa for being so tremendously awesome. PS - I joined yelp just so I can review this place!!!

Very disappointed, showed up on Friday night 2 days after Valentine's Day and basically we were turned away from an empty restaurant because we wanted to do happy hour and they were doing a Valentine's menu. And all we wanted was some appetizers and a drink. The worst part was the attitude of the maitre d and makes me question if I ever want to go back there again. I mean if they have a totally empty bar and they can't make cheese fondue and make a couple of drinks that's very sad but we found happiness Bottega Italian restaurant just next door! From Chef Jill
We spent our ninth anniversary here! The food was delicious! We each had the four course meal with endless meat. We added our own desserts with the curtains closed...lol. Very fun!
This was our first visit to a Melting Pot and loved it! The atmosphere was very warm and quiet. The food was excellent and served in a timely manner. We will be going back soon!!
We had a wonderful time! Plan for a slow, relaxing meal. It is on the pricey side as others have said but you are paying for the experience, not just the food.

Took the wife here for date night, love the food here!! service is world class. can't say a bad thing about this place, except I wish they had one closer to our neck of the woods.....Gilbert that is!!

This place is awesome!  Our server, CJ, is the best.  Our group was a bit goofy and CJ was such a good sport.  The entire staff is friendly and helpful and the food is amazing!  Such a great experience!

Food was pretty good.  Server was friendly, but we had a difficult time understanding his accent.  Normally OK, but unfortunate here since there is more waiter-interaction than normal.

The décor in this place was a bit dilapidated.  When we arrived, we weren't sure if we were at the right door because there was no sign, and the main entrance looked like the paint was fading (so we thought it might have been a service entrance).  Inside, there were dark booths with the wood stain on the walls coming off probably from the steam that the fondue pots produce.  The black napkins had some white lint on them.  

The waiter recommended a "garlic and wine" seasoning be sprinkled on the wedge salad.  It was in a large plastic style spice bottle like you would find at the grocery store.  Not classy at all, and it didn't taste very good either (luckily I just sprinkled a little into my hand and onto a small part of the salad because it came out pretty fast).

For the price ($170 after tip and 2-3 drinks each) we expected better service and a more pristine environment.
Classic melting pot. Meat was alright, veggies were alright, everything was pretty adequate. About to try dessert though, so let's hope for the best! Hostess was kinda weird too...

We celebrated our engagement at The Melting Pot and the food, as always, was amazing.

We started out with the spinach artichoke dip and I have to say, I could have passed on everything else and just had the cheese. We also had the California salad, my favorite, and the house salad. The house salad was okay, but the California was delicious. 

For the entries, we had the Pacific Rim and the French Quarter with the Mojo broth. Both were absolutely delicious and surpassed our expectations. 

For dessert we got the smores chocolate and actually agreed to "enhance our dippers" for an additional $5.95 and I wish we wouldn't have. It wasn't worth it and the red velvet cheesecake wasn't any good. 

All in all it was a delicious dinner. Only thing I would change is how many times they stop by your table to take your picture. We felt like they were knocking every time we put a bite in our mouths and no one likes to talk with their mouth full. We will definitely be returning though.

I know we all have different tastes, likes, and dislikes.  That being said, this restaurant was a very big disappoint to us.  The idea is fun and a great way to spend the evening with someone you like.  We enjoyed the cheese fondue with the bread.  For some reason, we did not find the main course to be of any "palatal" interest to us.  Chocolate fondue for dessert was very nice.  We ordered mixed drinks that were WAY too sweet and didn't seem to have much alcohol.  Ambiance is nice, but overall we found the food to be quite "blah"....especially for the price.  Sad to say, I just cannot recommend this restaurant.

I like this location better than the one in Scottsdale, I think the staff is way friendlier. 

I don't really think it's worth eating actual dinner here, in my eyes it's only good for cheese and chocolate courses. 

BUT do be sure to sign up for their mailing list, I have gotten some AWESOME deals.

The pros: the ambiance, the food, and the uniqueness of it all.

The setting is very relaxing and romantic. We had never had fondue before, and found it very entertaining. Our waiter was attentive without being over bearing.

The cons: the price and it can get pretty busy.

I don't remember our exact total, but I do remember thinking "holy crap" when they brought the check. Also make sure to plan ahead. Show up without reservations and you'll end up waiting a while.

Overall the experience was pleasant.
Great food, great service! This was my first visit and it was amazing. Will probably try a private booth next time.

Fall in love with fondue at the Melting Pot! The cheese fondue and the dessert fondue are my favorites, but the entrees aren't shabby either! Come hungry and expect to stay several hours. The only reason I gave 4/5 stars is for the price. We are teachers and about go broke dining here, but once in awhile we need to give ourselves a treat and splurge! Atmosphere is great for special occasions.  
Cheese fondue favorite = Swiss
Dessert fondue favorite = yin/yang (while & dark chocolate)
Had a great time celebrating our daughters birthday.  Megan our waitress was awesome!!!Food was excellent. ...cooked to perfect by us...lol.
I wasnt thrilled with the taste of the food compared to how pricy it is. I would have enjoyed a juicy steak somewhere else. However i do like the romance of fondue

This place is amazing, not too mention Delicious!  We enjoy the 4 Course Meals with some friends and dip, ate, laugh, dip tell we couldn't eat another thing.  Highly recommend especially for a celebration of any kind.

Loved this date, the food was pretty much what I anticipated as a fondue fan. I was floored however by their extensive dessert menu, where the flaming turtle using dark chocolate was the highlight of the meal. It will be in the potential date night rotation in the future.

The service was friendly and the food was delicious. It's fun to take an evening for a relaxed dinner. This is not a place to go if you're in a hurry, it's served in courses, from delicious cheese to quality cuts of meet and fresh veggies to a delectable dessert of fruits dipped in the chocolate of your choice. Our server was excellent as well. This is our go to place for special occasions. We always leave stuffed!

What a GREAT experience! 

Jeremy was absolutely WONDERFUl! He offered suggestions for making our meal the most tasteful possible! 

I would recommend this location to ANYONE! Everyone is very nice and personable! You can't go wrong for a date night here!

We went here for our 1st wedding anniversary and we were not too impressed  .... they are very expensive for mediocre food. While it's a neat idea to cook your food in the fondue pot at your table the food was very mediocre.... at best. We waited at the host stand for 7 minutes before we even saw 1 person working and the service is very slow. They also sat everyone in the same section which yes might be easier for them but most people are going for a special occasion and want a little privacy. If you insist on going I would say only go for dessert.

Went here for the first time yesterday as a surprise date night with my fiancé, and the food was VERY good. The cheese was great, salad was fresh, dinner was amazing and dessert was over-the-top amazing. However, our waiter was beyond sub-par. I was incredibly disappointed in the service. Our waiter seemed super bothered since it was our first time and he had to explain the process to us. He was rushing us. I was literally chewing on something with my fork in my hand and he puts his hand on my salad plate and asks, "Are you done with this?". Well, now that your hand is on it I suppose I am. Then, we asked how do we cook things? And, he gave us a 10 word response. We had to learn our whole process from the server next door who was phenomenal. I was so, so upset about the service. And, to top it all off, we bought a $50 bottle of wine and the server broke the cork which fell into the wine, he still served it in our glasses and said, "looks fine to me". I requested him to send it back so he rolled his eyes at me and then had someone else in the back funneled it. Management really need to evaluate this server.

My boyfriend and I ate at the Melting Pot for the first time on Christmas Eve and I loved it! We chose the 4 course meal: cheese fondue, salad, entree, and chocolate fondue. First you decide on a cheese fondue, we did cheddar, and dip items such as bread, veggies, and apples. Next is a small salad, the bacon apple salad was tasty. Then you chose proteins for your entree and a sauce to cook them in, they come raw and you cook them yourself in the sauce, very fun and interactive. The steak is absolutely delicious. Next was my favorite part, dessert. You pick a chocolate fondue, we chose amores and it comes with angel food cake, brownies, blondies, marshmallows, strawberries, bananas, and pineapples for dipping. The meal did take a few hours but I enjoyed myself the whole time. It is pricey, but definitely worth it. Our server was very friendly as well, I'll definitely be returning!

My friends and I went here the other night. There were 4 of us. One has Celiac Disease so we needed 2 pots., so one would be gluten free. They were completely uninterested in accommodating us in anyway. I seriously have never seen 4 people who work at a restaurant stand  around so helplessly and so less interested in seating guests at an empty restaurant. It was ridiculous. Their loss. We went elsewhere with our money and had a lovely evening.

Not the biggest fan of sharing a pot in between a big group of people and having to cook it ourselves. It was a bit confusing yes I should of researched more about it before going but it was for a friends birthday but I would not go myself. I would recommend looking up the experience but paying 70 dollars for one plate and beer having it to cook it yourself sharing a pot in between like four of our friends was not the best concept. Food was okay definitely not worth the price and left still hungry. The experience maybe good for some people but not my personal preference be ready to pay!

My friend and i went here tonight to celebrate my birthday and were very happy with the service, the delicious food, and the scrumptious chocolate covered strawberries they gave me for my birthday. Our waiter Tyler was awesome! He was very nice and helpful and we were extremely pleased with the help we received.

We go to this Melting Pot for our anniversary every year. It never really disappoints. The food is always great. The price is steep but when you go once a year, it's fine. I really do encourage the 4 course as that's where you'll get your value.

We came in Saturday with a Deal Chicken voucher. The service was AMAZING! We had a private booth behind a curtain and despite having to move tables because our burner was broken, we couldn't have asked for better service. 

The spinach and artichoke fondue was wonderful, the salads were good but the entrée was Meh, as soon as it came I dropped a couple potatoes to get them going, by the time we were done eating the potatoes still weren't done which is a huge disappointment. I wish they would partially cook them first. 

The ravioli was wonderful. 


We didn't get desert because we were too full. Next time.

We love fondue! Victor was a fantastic server, friendly, explanatory and fun! We had the "endless" fondue. The spinach artichoke cheese starter was so yummy! Creamy and slightly spicy. The entree was endless protein and we used the MOJO style to cook the proteins. The shrimp was so delicious! Finished it off with the plain milk chocolate fondue for dessert. Hands down yummy! Great food and superb service! We will be back soon!
Delicious! Turtle chocolate and lobster tail for entree is the best. Attentive and friendly waiters

This place has something for everyone I think. The four course meal is the most affordable way to go from what I've calculated unless you are only coming in for one or maybe two courses. When you do the 4 course the first is a choice of cheese fondue, then a salad, then your choice of proteins which arrive raw and you cook them in a pot of a broth of your choice, and lastly you pick your dessert chocolate fondue. The meal can take up to a couple hours so be prepared with some time. I enjoy coming but the price often prevents me from coming as much as I'd like. If you follow their emails, their promotions are helpful in bringing the price down a little bit.

This is my fourth trip here with my fiancee and this place gets more delicious every time. The new premium meat dippers are fantastic. Our server Bethany was great and very helpful regarding new menu changes. We had the spinach artichoke cheese and it made our month. We get a different cheese every time and they never disappoint. 5 stars

Not impressed. We had never been to the Melting Pot and decided to try it for our 20th anniversary. My husband called to ask a few questions and make a reservation. The day of the reservation we called to change the time. We changed our reservation from 5:45 to 4. No issues there. When my husband made the original reservation he booked the private booth and the 4 course dinner for 2. 
We arrived at 4 when they opened. The place was extremely dead because it was so early. We paid extra for the private booth and after arriving realized that was a waste of money and totally unnecessary. The extra money paid included rose pedals on the table and a picture in a plastic frame. The booth we were placed in was intended for 2 people. OMG it was so small and cramped. The table was so small that everything was touching and crowded as it arrived to the table. Not enough room. If you are claustrophobic you will not be able to be in this booth. Because it it a table for 2 you only get 1 fondue pot. This means that even though you are paying for 2 different meals both people have to agree on the same cheese and chocolate. Not a huge deal but worth mentioning. 
1st course was the cheese. We got the fiesta cheese. It was good but for sure did not WOW us. Especially considering the price. 
The salads arrived next. Good but very small. 
The 3rd course came.... RAW meat. Now I take responsibility for not researching this better and just assuming. I thought the meats would be cooked and there would be fondue to dip the meat in. Not the case. They fill the fondue pot with broth for you to boil the raw meat in. The seasoned Court Bouillon is the standard and is at no extra cost. The other selections will cost you extra. We had the mojo. It was good but again nothing special. I found this experience to be frustrating. You had to cook your own food. So you would put a small piece of meat on the fondue stick and place it in the broth. Then you had to time it. They suggested 2 minutes for the meats. So we were sitting there with our phone timer on boiling meat. 2 minutes was not enough time for my taste. I took my meat out, cut it and blood went all over the plate. I nearly lost it. I do not do rare anything. I am a very well done kind of girl. For me I had to leave the meat in for 4-5 minutes. The meats came with dipping sauces. In my opinion comparable to those you get when ordering chicken nuggets for your kids. Once your meat came out of the pot you had to put another piece in. So while you were doing that your tiny bite of meat that you took out of the boiling water would get cold. The meat was very GOOD! The portion again was small. 
So again you put raw meat in a pot of boiling broth, set the timer on your phone, wait, take the meat out and put it on your plate. Then you grab another piece of meat, put it in the pot of boiling broth, reset the timer and eat the bite you just took out of the pot of broth. 
Finally the chocolate fondue and dessert tray came. Everything was good. 
I honestly feel that this place is over priced. Our bill for 2 people to have a 4 course meal in a tiny booth with a curtain that included rose pedals on the table and a picture was $135. This included tip. We drank water. The food was good, not great. Our server was fine, no issues with her.

Our party of seven came in for Father's Day to take advantage of the $39.95 four course meal with paired craft beers and it was fantastic! Making an appointment was simple and we arrived on time to get seated in a private booth with two burners. The first course was salads and most of us went with the Caesar or House which was topped with a Honey Mustard type dressing. We were then given the option of cheeses (southwestern jalapeno was definitely the best) served with veggies, chips, bread and apples. For the main course we had the endless meat option that included shrimp, filet mignon, chicken, spinach raviolis (my personal favorite) and teriyaki steak. Our waitress gave perfect directions and it's really fun to just de-stress and get to cook each bite and explore all the sauces- there was literally like 8 options! We ended with two chocolate pots served with rice crispies, pound cake, fruits, brownies, etc. Most people couldn't even finish their paired beers as it's A LOT of food and worth the price. One major downfall was the temperature. Once those pots get going and everyone is crowded around the booth it can be very hot- especially when the steam is facing directly at you. Understandably, the restaurant can't do too much, but maybe keep it a bit cooler or use suction fans to extract the heat. I'll definitely be back for happy hour and to redeem my birthday coupon for free strawberries!  P.S. Check their Facebook page for the picture they take of you and your group!
Great anniversary dinner. Fabulous fondue, service our server Lyric is amazing. We'll be back.

Went for my friends birthday. You really can't go wrong with Melting Pot. This one stands apart for its service. We had a fantastic time and every single person wished her a happy birthday. It was very sweet. Our water glasses were never below half, and our "dippers" came out with perfect timing. They also made three special plates for us since we had some food allergies in our group. I really think you should try this one just based on service alone. We had Lisa, and she was adorably sweet.
What a wonderful holiday weekend in a wonderful quite setting. The staff  was great and the beer and wine selection was exceptional. Nice to have this in The Tuke.

I have not had fondue in about 5 years, so I decided to visit The Melting Pot to celebrate my December birthday. From the moment we walked in until we left our experience was fabulous. We were seated in a nice quiet booth in the back. By the midpoint of our dinner, the other tables were sat, so it was nice to have the privacy at the start. The tables face each other is a kind of awkward way (because of the position of the cooktop there really isn't another way to make it work) and in order to keep patrons safe, the lighting cannot be dimmed. We participated in a fundraiser for Helping Hands Arizona, so our menu was a set - 4 course meal. We enjoyed the cheddar for our first round, salads for the second, a nice variety of meats/seafood cooked in the coq au vin style (shrimp & marinated meat were my faves), and for the chocolate round we chose dark chocolate with Bailey's (oreo covered marshmallows & pound cake were the best!) - all courses were delicious. The server and her trainee were extremely informative to the necessary steps to making the meal a success. 

They had asked at the start if we were celebrating anything so I owned up to the fact that it was my birthday. They were kind enough to serve desert on a "Happy Birthday" plate (no singing, thank goodness!) and gifted us with some desert to take home! It was more than we expected!. Thanks again for a wonderful evening - we will be back. 

Unfortunately my cell phone would not co-operate last night to post this review but better late than never!

I've always been a fan of The Melting Pot. In every city. This was the first time here in Phoenix & my husbands first time ever. The food was (as always) awesome. We went on a Wednesday and there were 12 cars in the parking lot. We waited almost 45 in the bar and although our waiter was training someone, our service continued to decline. To his benefit, he kept apologizing and comped our $10 bottle of wine. After $130 for 2 people, I just wish the service was as good as the food.

I don't "do" girls night out.  But for The Melting Pot, I "did do" girl's night out.  I went with three girls that I cheered with back in high school.  I mean waaaayyyyy back in high school.  How far back?  No business of yours, sir!  Anyhow, after reconnecting after ...let's call it "many" years... the four of us went to TMP for 'couples night'.  We feigned lesbian love in order to fit into a great special, and I'm not afraid to admit it!  No, really, they didn't seem to care, as long as we were in groups of two.  
If you read nothing else, read this:  Plan on three + hours here.  Savor.  Enjoy.  Linger.  It takes that long... it just DOES.  Do not tell your spouse (or babysitter or cat or whomever you answer to) that you'll be home in two hours.  Ahem.
Onward!
Best highlight of the night for me: the Search and Rescue Spoon!!!!!  This struck my funny bone so hard and it was the topic of many jokes and pictures throughout the night.
If you are looking for a place to take kids, do the rest of us a favor:  DON'T COME HERE.  Go someplace where the food is served in nugget form, and removal of shoes is appropriate. We don't want to hear your kids whine or your baby scream.  I have kids but there's a time and a place, people.  The rest of us come to places like this just to get away from you.  
Moving on!
I could wax fond for hours giving loving descriptions of the food here, I really could.  It was both unique AND delicious.  The experience of it is incredibly fun, the atmosphere feels SO intimate somehow (no awkward eye contact with anyone who isn't at your table) and everything about it just amazing.  There was an "appetizer" course, a "main" course, and a "dessert" course.  You can choose to dip or cook your food in any kind of cheese or broth... but let's be honest, it's all foreplay leading up to to what really matters there:  the dessert course.  
We chose the "S'mores" dessert experience.  I'm not being pretentious... it really is an *experience*.  Just think:a giant pot of melted chocolate, swirled with marshmallow cream, which gets some sort of flammable (I'm assuming liquor) poured on top and set on fire, which toasts the marshmallow creme, and THEN they add the crushed graham crackers.... and after THAT we got to dip things like cheesecake, rice krispy treats, poundcake, strawberries, and brownies in the hot melty S'morey goodness... let me just say that I briefly experienced Nirvana.
Yes, yes, I hear people say it's expensive, and I guess that is relative.  If you've stayed at the Aria, or in a suite at Mandalay Bay, or anywhere decent in Vegas for a week and paid $40 for a drink poolside, then comparatively/relatively....  it was downright cheap.  
(If you get all indignant over anything that doesn't come from the dollar menu at McDonalds, then don't go to Vegas and don't go to The Melting Pot.  Seriously, just stay at home and crab about inflation and watch some public television, you'll be happier.)    As for me, the whole point of working is to earn money that then enables me to go places and eat things and buy stuff for my family.  This falls in the category of "going to a Place" and "eating Things" so I was happy.
Once we split up the dinner bill, I felt that my portion (including the completely  optional dessert course and one adult beverage- so if you must be a tightwad you could do it for less than I did) of only $40 was downright freaking CHEAP, worth every last cent and then some... and I can't wait to go back!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

A bit overpriced for melted cheese, but always tasty.  The tricks are going on the girls night out - a fixed price 3 course menu or during happy hour for cheese and chocolate.  Staff is always friendly and helpful.

What a fun experience! The staff here is so friendly, helpful, and prompt! We came here for our anniversary dinner and will definitely be back! The prices are expensive but it's so worth it for what you get. This place is awesome!

Ok
I hate doing this
I really wish I didn't love a chain fondue restaurant more than the independant fondue places in AZ...

But Melting Pot does fondue very well.  Better than the other fondue options.

I'm not a fan of their cheese

However, their Yin Yang chocolate fondue is SO FREAKING GOOD

So yeah.
Darn.  I love the Melting Pot.
Don't waste your time or money, this place sucks big time.  Tasteless food, shotty service. I would never go back!

I can never get enough of this place!! We came for cheese and chocolate this trip and it was fantastic and our server Lyric was as sweet as could be!! Thank you for another awesome experience!!  See you soon...

I have been making my husband take me to the Melting Pot for the past 10 years for my birthday, our anniversary, special occasions (the Easton/Columbus, OH location). Eventually, he grew to enjoy it also. We visit at least 4 times a year and have always had a nice experience.
We moved to AZ last year and have been to the Phoenix location once prior to this encounter (with average at best service), and twice at the Scottsdale location (had good service).
We decided to invite a group of friends for fondue before New Year. None of our friends had dined at a Melting Pot before, so we wanted them to experience what we had in the past.
The Scottsdale location is far superior (ambience, service, decor, etc.), however, the Phoenix location was more central to all of our friends to meet at. I made reservations 2 weeks prior for our group.
I checked in the hostess desk and most of our group had arrived. I asked the hostess if she could direct our missing friends to our table when they arrived. She took us to out table, which was in the back part of the restaurant next to a restroom and some abandoned chairs and supplies. (Messy). There was no privacy in this room (and not much privacy at this location in general) In other locations you get a nice private table/space, a table with a high partition, or a curtain.
When our friends joined us at the table, they said the person at the desk gave them a hard time about which party they were with. They only found us because another staff member decided to help them.
Our waiter came to the table and took our drink orders. That took a while (fine), and 2 came back wrong. Then, the waiter asked us what cheese style we wanted. We looked at the menu, picked 2 styles. He disappeared. A long while later he appeared with the pots, cheese, dippers. ...the weird part? He was handing out plates and doing all of this when we hadn't even ordered our meals yet. We still had our tacky, plastic menu placecards. I started wondering if we were going to be eating that night at all at this point (it had been almost an hour). My husband started to lose his patience and asked if he could place his salad and entree order so he could remove the giant menu and have a place for his plate/bread/cheese. It was really bizarre. During the meal random young staff members stopped at our table and awkwardly asked us questions-once we were eating and a girl wanted to take our picture for the Facebook page.
Usually the waiter starts out the meal with an explanation of the experience, cooking styles etc. And usually, you and your waiter chit chat because they spend so much time prepping and stirring the food. This time we hardly saw or spoke with our waiter. At the end of the meal he brought one check and never asked if we wanted it split. By the end of this ordeal we all just wanted to get out of there as fast as we could.
This experience was so awful it makes me question my love for this place. The service was awful, the overall experience was horrible, the ambience was non-existent, the decor cheap and tacky. 
Our friends were confused and unhappy with the experience (first time visitors). They all said they would not return.
I would never recommend this location.  And with an almost $500 dinner tab and complete garbage service and experience,  I don't think I will be returning much in the new year. Save yourself a lot of money and grief and avoid this location like the plague.
So amazingly disappointing.
Went out for a girls night, had so much fun! Great dining experience and the bartender Alex was great! I would recommend this place!

I took my daughter here last night for her 10th birthday with 10 other people. I called a few days before and made a reservation. Our table was ready for us when we arrived. We tried all 3 cheese's and they were phenomenal! I ordered the land and sea and it was awesome! Our service was great and the staff were friendly, accommodating, and they all had a great sense of humor. They were detailed when it came to directions for how to cook the food and answered all of our questions. They checked on us and cleared the table without us having to ask. The white chocolatier fondue with pound cake was one of the best things I have ever had. This place is worth the price and the experience was unforgettable!! We can't wait to go back.

Listened to OpenTable request to sit in a secluded area, which was great. Food and service was excellent. Great specials make the cost worth-while and valuable. Fun, delicious dining experience. We'll probably be back sooner than we thought! Such a great restaurant for special occasions.

We came on Mother's Day. It was clean and quiet, nice atmosphere. We ended up having to wait quite a while in between courses because the kitchen was backed up. Our server was wonderful and the manager noticed we had to keep waiting and took great care of us during the meal and in the end. We drove from Queen Creek to Ahwatukee especially for the delicious chocolate fondue! Well done, we'll be back.

This place is the bomb!  I've been wanting to come here for so long.  DH & I finally made it out here and it was all I ever hoped for it to be.  The food was fantastic and our server was great.  We ordered the Big Night Out which includes smoked cheddar with Sam Adam's cheese fondue, wedge salads, variety of meat to dip in fondue for entree and a milk chocolate fondue for dessert.  We were stuffed by the end of our meal.  Wouldn't change a thing!

I am a huge fan of fondue and this place has got it down right.  A four course meal is the way to go, starting out with a cheese fondue of your choice, then a salad, then an entree (I prefer the broth for dipping rather than the oil as it makes the meat just so darn tender), and then of course, the dessert in the form of a chocolate fondue.  The seating is very intimate and private in large booths.  This is not a place to go for a quick meal, but a place to savor the food and the company.

I'd give this restaurant a thousand stars if i could. My husband and I are doing the Keto-diet. The manager and server went above and beyond to accomidate us. We assumed we just wouldn't eat dessert because we can only eat 70%+ dark chocolate and berries. The manager came and asked us about our diet restrictions, drove to the grocery store and purchased the right kind of dark chocolate and berries to make a Keto-friendly fondue, no extra charge, and even after we told him it wasnt at all expected. I never knew this kind customer service existed. I always loved this restaurant but they just made a very happy customer out of me. Also it was my birthday, so that made it an extra special night. Thank you Melting Pot for a wonderful dinner and birthday dessert!

Folks, I'm sorry if this review comes across as snooty, which it probably is. But can you really fault me for that, when I brought my Parisian then-wife to this place and one of the first things they told us was, "Since you've never dined with us before, just so you know, what we do here is give you an authentic European style meal." Amused at this bold proclamation that we were about to get an "authentic European style meal" at a Florida-based chain restaurant on Ray Road, we stifled our laughter as our teenage waiter proceeded to tell us what it means to eat food "European style". 

Apparently, a genuine Yorapeon experience consists of a vat of melted chocolate followed by a vat of melted cheese. Not at the same time! That would be American style. No, see, the European way is to bring the vats out in succession. And charge $8 billion for it. Even though I last dined here with mon epouse 3 years ago, I actually remember to this day that our bill was $75 for two including wine pre-tip, which we both thought was a major rip-off. 

I do have a logical reason to give this place a bad review. The problem we had with the Melting Pot was simply that it claims to be something that it is not. I've been to fondue places in France and Switzerland, and the Melting Pot is sure as hell nothing like those. Which would be fine if it weren't playing it up to consumers like it was. And it would also be fine if it didn't cost as much to dine here as it costs to dine at a TRULY authentic French/European restaurant in town, such as Sophie's or Vincent's. This place draws you in by claiming to give you a "European" experience, which it simply doesn't do. Why would you want to pay 50 bucks a person for that? 

I will say that the atmosphere is cozy, comfortable, and affords you privacy to enjoy a romantic meal with your significant other. Granted. And I have no complaints about the quality or taste of the food either. Also granted. But if I feel like splurging a hundred bucks on a romantic meal with someone, I just don't understand why anyone would do so at this national chain wannabe-slash-poser restaurant instead of a truly nice, unique, authentic place elsewhere in the Valley. Va Bene is only a mile or two away, after all.

To each their own.

What another fun night out with the hubby!!! We can for a late Valentine's Day dinner. The food was AMAZING and they had a great deal going on for V-day!!  When you go you HAVE to buy there garlic and wine seasoning! It is SO DELICIOUS on ANYTHING!!! I don't recommend upgrading the cooking style, stick with the classic bullion. It's the best!! If want chocolate covered strawberries make sure you order them when you make the reservation. They DO NOT have them on hand. This is definitely one of my favorite places to enjoy a nice long relaxing meal!!
Outstanding service by Megan, she made our dining experience amazing. Thank you and we will highly recommend the melting pot to all our friends.
Great happy hour specials! They also do a special during the summer when the temp hits a certain point they give free chocolate or cheese fondue to they're facebook fans.

I was not a believer, but one of my friends said I would not be disappointed so I gave it a shot  Happy Hour in the bar is $5 a person per section ($5 cheese, $5 chocolate, $4, salad, and drink specials as well).  I was super surprised, it was all really good of course, and I was FULL!!!  Also, you can have more bread and dessert for free if you have and of your cheesy or chocolatey goodness left!  Took a lot of time, I think we were there for like 2 hours but I would do it again.

My Wife and I love the melting pot.  Great food, romantic setting, attentive service, and fun concept.  They offer an ample gluten free selection for me while still giving my wife the ability to eat off the normal menu.  We always plan a couple of hours when we visit and turn it into an event...not a meal.  Turtle chocolate fondue is the best...give it a shot!

We've been trying to use our Living Social deal to this place for a couple months now... we finally had the chance on Saturday night.  My take on Melting Pot has always been that the cheese and the dessert are awesome - but that I could pretty much do without the meat course in the middle.

So we started with the spinach artichoke cheese fondue, which was really really good.  The wedge salad with bacon and peppercorn ranch, also good.  Then we got to the meat course.  Without turning this into a novel, we discovered that one of the shrimp that had been cooking in our broth fhad not been de-turded.  That's right, it had been cooking with the rest of our meat, in poo-broth.  

So, there goes the appetite, and after bringing it up to the waiter - and his discussing it with the manager - they were "gracious" enough to take a $5 beer off our tab.

I'm sorry, but serving poop to customers, should pretty much be a no-no.  Especially at those prices.  I kept thinking of the line from one of my favorite movies, The Jerk, "You would think, at these prices, you could keep the POOP off the food!".

I digress... suffice it to say, we won't be going back to The Melting Pot.

The food is great as usual. And the service there never disappoints. Jeremy was awesome. 

Fondue Feast. Lager and Cheddar Cheese fondue. The meats had the advertising Latin spin for the current Big Night Out. The dessert was dark chocolate with sea salt. All was A-OK.

The table next to us was inhabited by two of the most annoying groups of diners I've ever experienced. When we arrived, the meal was winding down for a mother, her 13-ish old daughter, and that daughter's friend. If they hadn't been so young, I would have sworn the girls were drunk off their respective asses. They kept screaming across the restaurant for the waiter, thinking they were going to hook him up with their cougar mom. I'm thinking that probably wasn't an option, as I'm pretty sure the waiter didn't play for that team. But hearing yells of  "WE NEED MORE NAPKINS JEREMY" was enough to make want to throw hot bouillon over the wall onto their skank little heads.

We had about 15 minutes of quiet after they left, until this weird older couple was seated at the same table. The woman had a ghastly hat that looked like she had shopped at Savers for a hat to wear to the Churchill Downs. It was white with lots of lace and feathers and crap. And she left it on the entire meal. They went on an on with the waiter about how it was their 24th anniversary, we got to hear about restaurants that the husband was "forbidden to go to" because of his flatulence, we were subjected to them listening to Jack Johnson on their phone, and had to hear their incessant nincompoopery while we finished our dessert.

Love the Melting Pot, but maybe will go to one in a different area of town next time.

Me and my wife have been coming here for years. A cozy, romantic place to celebrate an anniversary, birthday or a date. You want a place for a first date? Come here. We always go with the four-course dinner. Everything is included. You get your cheese fondue, I recommend the "Fiesta" cheese. You get a great salad and then you choose your entries and finish with a chocolate fondue. The entire time your are here is so relaxing. We have been here for 1-2 hours, just enjoying each other. You lose track of time, because there is no hurry. You cook everything at your table in the pot on your table. Its so fun and different. We are always treated so good here. Now you will spend some money here, but if you really want a special night, this  is the place. I Give it a GIANT Woo Hoo!

Fondue, first time I've partaken in this special way of eating. Hot chocolate sauce, and peanut butter, with very different types of treats. Will definitely come back to try the dinner service. PS, excellent place to take a date.

Rip off.  The only reason I did not give this place a one star is because we did not get sick.  The place is way too expensive for what you get.  I ask the girl if the meat was frozen, she replied how could you tell. The taste give it away.

My husband and I had a gift card and decided to come here for his birthday. This was our first time coming to Melting Pot. The first thing I noticed is how underwhelming the decor inside the restaurant is- for such an expensive experience, you would think the ambiance would be modern. Our waiter was nice and attentive- we also got our picture taken but never saw it at the end of the night. Our waiter explained the cooking process and options on the menu, including drinks. We went with the 4 course option and stated with the fontina cheese fondue. Neither my husband or I liked it- it's a very pungent flavor. One thing we learned quickly is if you want something cooked, it needs to be at the very bottom of the pot (raw veggies served in the first course don't taste good with hot cheese in my opinion). Anyways, next were salads, which we LOVED. I ordered the California and he ordered the Apple Bacon. I literally want to make the raspberry vinaigrette dressing at home because it was THAT good! Next was the meat course- I went with the pacific rim (pot-stickers, duck, sirloin and shrimp)- hubby had the land and sea (filet, shrimp, and chicken). We went with the mojo sauce to cook the meat and it provided some flavor but not a lot. We ended up adding other flavors in the pot to make the flavors pop. The sauces they provide on the side are very good, especially the greek goddess sauce for the mushrooms- stuff them after they cook and they are amazing! 

Take away from this dining experience- I know it's supposed to be an "experience" cooking your food but when you only get 2 skewers at a time, it takes FOREVER to get through all the meat and veggies they give you on the side to cook. The potatoes were in the pot from the beginning of the meat cooking process and they never really cooked all the way through- why potatoes? By the time we finished dinner, we were exhausted and hot (the cooking pot being in front of you for 2+ hours makes the space a little toasty). 

For dessert, we went with the smores fondue, which was the best thing we ate all night. It came with brownies, strawberries, pineapple, banana, shortcake and rice krispies. It was also nice because it came on a happy birthday plate and we sang to my husband for his birthday. We also had a coupon for chocolate covered strawberries and received a box at the end of dinner (call ahead for those though). And, if you check in on Yelp, you get a free bottle of the garlic and wine seasoning. 

I can't say the service or food wasn't great because it was and I have no complaints there. My husband and I both agreed we just didn't enjoy the 2.5 hour dinner experience enough to come back. We also thought it was really expensive ($125 for 2 people). I'm glad we tried this but I don't know if we would really want to come back.

The melting pot is always a great place to go with a date, it is nice because the dinner is an experience, and the staff is in no hurry to get you moving so they can fit another table in. 

I have to knock down a star because they took away the quattro formaggio cheese (the reason I went to this place as often as I did). The spinach and artichoke is pretty good, and the desert is always amazing. I have always enjoyed every server we have had at the melting pot, they are so nice and really knowledgable on all of the food. It is a little pricey sure but well worth it if you need a comfort food fix.

Had a wonderful evening at The Melting Pot Ahwatukee. Lavonte was our server and did  a great job of suggesting  menu items and combinations. We did the fondue raiser giving back program which was awesome because it was unlimited proteins for the main course. Shrimp and filet was great and even had a second portion of those. 
The GM stopped by several times to check on our dining experience. Will return for sure!
Fun experience, bacon Gorgonzola cheese was yummy.   Carmel toffee chocolate is tasty!!

Finally made it to the Melting Pot. It's been on our "must try" list for a very long time.  I've seen some reviews that complain about the service, but we didn't have any complaints. We were immediately seated (we did have reservations) and promptly served. This is not a quick dining experience,  so come prepared to spend some time and bit be in a rush.

We had 4 in our party. We each ordered the unlimited 4 course meal, which is by far the best value. The cheese course was yummy, but word to the wise - don't fill up on bread! The Caprese salads were perfect - very fresh. The meat course was great. We had filet, teriyaki steak, shrimp, ravioli, and chicken. We also added the lobster tail for an additional $8. Everything was fresh, tender and delicious!

We ended our dinner with the Chocolate Turtle fondue for dessert. Fabulous! Just wish we weren't so full so we could've eaten more. 

Our server, Steven, was on the ball, did a great job explaining everything, and we were quite impressed. 

Be prepared to spend a decent chunk of change there. You're paying for the experience and extra work the servers have to do, but it's worth it.

For my first visit to The Melting Pot, I decided to go on my birthday with my husband, my parents and his parents.
We were sat in a back room all by ourselves. Literally we could have heard a pin drop. Normally, I would have LOVED this ... However it must have been a package deal: get your own room, get crappy service.
Granted, I didn't expect to be in and out of the place within an hour, but I also didn't expect it to take three and a half hours either! Our server was SO slow. We normally NEVER have a lack of dinner conversation, however we found ourselves twiddling our thumbs just waiting for our server several times.
The food, however, was delicious. But NOT worth the prices they charge.
Unfortunately, this was my first and last visit to The Melting Pot.

As always great service and food! Went for date night on a Friday and was seated quickly and with an amazing waiter! Had the spinach artichoke cheese fondue, chicken in court bouillon and the strawberry shortcake chocolate fondue...All of it was AMAZING!! I also had the sailor's punch which was nice and fruity. The total for two with drinks was just under $100 so it's not a cheap night out...but definitely worth it every once in a while :D

Seven of us took my daughter there for her birthday. The service was incredibly slow. Over three hours for food we cooked at the table!  The food quality seemed ok but the bill was over $500 and only two alcoholic drinks were served. When we left my 28 year old son wanted to stop and grab a burger. He is not overweight in the slightest and there was not enough food for him. After talking to the remaining guests everyone felt that way. I'll never be back. I'd rather spend $700 at a better restaurant.  Please comment and follow me for more reviews! I would love to have you!

Had such a great Date Night here last night with the hubby, fantastic service by our waiter Conan, food was amazing and the cocktails were delicious! The intimacy and ambiance is unbeatable, we'll definitely go here again and again!

The melting pot use to be the place to go to have a great time and have great service! We had gone to the one in north scottsdale the last two times and had horrible service so we decided to give this location a try. 

The actual taste of the dessert was probably the only good thing going however, the restaurant use to offer more of each item of the desserts and when we asked why it changed our waitress explained it was because people would sit for hours upon hours just enjoying dessert asking for more pieces to enjoy their chocolate with. Changing their menu for everything to be a la carte but keeping the same prices (each item at least $40) does not make it very affordable for many people. The only restaurant that we knew of for charging a $1 refill on soda and lemonade products. 

We decided to go with a couple which probably made it better then it would have been had we of been by ourselves, as our waitress was rude, did not like us asking questions or wanting us to change our minds. She was difficult to stop to ask for something and did not have very nice facial expressions.

The food was phenomenal, but it really is super expensive for what it is.  Which makes it perfect for a special but rare occasion.

Price: it runs between $16-$25 per course, so by the time u have a cheese appetizer,($16 serves two) entree ($25 per person), salad ($8 per person) and dessert, ($16-$32 serves two) you end up with a $100+ tab.   Significantly more if you order drinks.

My issue: don't get me wrong, the food really was superb.  However, the reason my review is so critical is because they have a happy hour 4-6, which significantly cheapens their prices.  I went especially for this after reading about it on yelp and on their site. But when I got there it wasn't mentioned at all, and even though we ordered supposed "happy hour" items there was no discount whatsoever, and my server didn't seem to know anything about it.  I felt sort of misled.

So good food.  High prices.  Left feeling kind of disappointed by the happy hour thing, so I'm really not sure I'd go back.  Would've been a good experience if we hadn't been jilted on the pricing.

Had been to a restaurant of this sort for the first time. I liked the idea of having a stove on the table and the chef preparing fondue on it. I admire the food, the ambience, the decorum of the chefs. The best thing about the menu here is the dark chocolate fondue. It was heaven!

I love the melting pot! This was my first time at this location and it was a little bit different from what I remember it being. 

The portions are smaller, but you can always ask for more dippers outside of the meats. This was the first time I ever took my kids, but they loved it. So tonight's dinner was a success. 

For dessert I always order the yin and yang, but with milk chocolate. When it arrived it was with dark. My kids were getting a little restless so I didn't say anything, but it is much better with milk chocolate. 

Outside of that small hiccup our server was pretty good and we will be back the next time I am in Phoenix.

Feeling generous with the one star today. Food was good but service was lacking. I don't believe that you should have to wait 30-40minutes for water to arrive at your table or watch your appetizer pot steam for that long either.  The bad service outweighed the food this time. Disappointed. Seems like the Melting Pot should read some of these reviews to make improvements.

Love this place. Had wonderful service. 
Will be back again. 
Food was amazing. 
We did the full blown fondue for party of 6. We all had a blast and enjoyed all the food.  The desert was out standing. Never had fondue desert before here and I will most definitely be back for more

My girlfriend and I went here for our valentines day dinner. It was excellent. Obviously it's more on the expensive side, so it may not be an "everyday" kind of place, but if you're looking for something for a special occasion or a romantic night out, this place is perfect.

My girlfriend is allergic to gluten and they had no problems accommodating that restriction. They all knew immediately what to do and we're knowledgable on the menu as it related to gluten.

Our server was a guy named Dan, and he was friendly, attentive, knowledgable and helpful throughout the whole meal. He suggested good foods, gluten free foods, good wines and answered any questions. 

Overall, I would highly recommend the melting pot.

We went here tonight for our anniversary.  This is our second visit to this location, and it has been a wonderful experience both times. 

I have always been impressed with the friendliness of the staff and their professional manner.  We have always come with coupons because it's the only way we can afford to go, and even though they are a high-end place, they have never looked down on us for that or treated us poorly.  We still feel like we're getting the best experience.  I wish I could remember our server's name, because she was wonderful.  

The food, of course, was delicious.  We had the spinach artichoke cheese and endless entrees. Our server recommended the Mojo broth, and it was awesome!  Flavorful, tangy, and a little bit of spice. It went well with everything.  I don't think I tried anything I didn't like.  

If you have never been here before, one thing to keep in mind is that it's a very intimate dining experience.  I recommend it for families and serious couples. You'll be eating close together since you're sharing a fondue pot, and this also means you're all putting your skewers in the same pot, so don't go there with anyone you wouldn't feel comfortable doing this with!  And also, it's expensive, so I wouldn't recommend it for a first date. 

I think this is a lovely place for special occasions, and I look forward to future celebrations there.

We have come here several times and always have a good experience! The last couple times the service has been soooo slow! For $160 the service needs to be more then 20 min waits just to get refills on soda.  It will be awhile before we come  back!

My husband and I went to the Ahwatukee establishment using the Living Social voucher. This was our very first visit and it may be our last. Let's just say for the actual price of the food that this restaurant isn't worthy of a revisit. 

Our waitress was nice but she wasn't attentive and she was quite sloppy. For instance, when taking our menu's away, instead of walking away with them she just places it on the wall divider between us and the adjacent booth. The menus were just lying around there the entire time, never picked up just flopping over into the other booth!!! Our waitress NEVER rounded, we kept on looking for her and another waitress from the table across from us ended up refilling our waters because she was taking forever when rounding. We noticed the waitress across from us was very good to their party, constantly rounding and making sure everybody had their refills and checking in on the food and if they wanted more entrees. Although our entrees were bottomless, we only received two platters because again our waitress took FOREVER to return to our table. By the time we received the second plate of meats our fondue practically ran out of steam and juice!! She also forgot about our champagne, gave us the check and walked away. We had to yet again ask for her because she took 10 hours long, then when she finally came back we explained we didn't receive our champagne and she was just like, "oh ya, i'll be back," didn't even apologized, was all nonchalant about it and we were like "really???" The service, at least from our waitress was ridiculous, we wished we had the other one sitting across from us who refilled our drinks, then maybe our experience would have been better.

Lastly, the decor!!!! Seriously for such a "high end" establishment, this place could use lots of remodeling... the decor is very 1990's and needs a make-up STAT!

We will give em props on the food, because it was DELICIOUS!! The salad wasn't a big deal, but the appetizers were AMAZING, same with the entrees, the meats were tender and succulent!! But alas, the lack of customer service from our waitress killed it for us, unfortunately.... :/

We wanted to love this place, but uh, we won't be coming back.
Seriously the funniest night we've had out!! Jeremy our waiter made the night! We'll definitely be back and asking for Jeremy!

Look, I had a gift card for $10 and no reason to go to The Melting Pot. So already this wasn't going to be the best experience ever.

The two stars I'm giving were for the first time I called to see if they would just do a ceaser salad w/chicken to go. I called around 2, not knowing this was a dinner only restaurant, but the lady I spoke to said she could prepare the salad for me, just not the chicken because the cooks weren't even in yet. She was very nice and I appreciated her willingness to accommodate me HOURS before they even open. But I decided to skip it, not wantging her to go to the trouble when they were closed. On her own, this lady was 4-5 stars,  and I wished I would've just had her make the salad. 

Ok. Skip ahead a week. Now I'm sick and call about 8 at night to see if I can pick up the salad on my way home from work. I'm told they don't do to go orders. I tell the girl I spoke with someone last week and she said no problem, so this girl puts me on hold to speak w/ a manager. She comes back and says yes to the salad, no to the chicken because they have no way to cook it. So, within 1 week, a restaurant has lost the ability to cook a chicken breast. Really? .... so I ask for a cup of hot tea, since I'm sick. She says "I promise you, there is no way I can give a to go drink". Oh, but I can take a teabag if I really need it.

I tell her to forget the whole thing. Way too difficult of a conversation, especially when 1)I'm ill and 2) a week earlier it was no problem. So now I have a giftcard, no salad, and a bad taste in my mouth from the experience

You guyssssss. Melted cheese. Cooking your own food. Melted chocolate. WINE!  

Seriously LOVE this place! Our waitress was a doll. She was super nice and knew answers to all our questions-they have a lot to memorize! 

First of all we got a bottle of Riesling. 

We got the spinach artichoke cheese fondue to start. They bring out the spinach in full leaves (wish they were chopped). It was delicious. I suggest not trying the brown sweet bread they bring with it... why melting pot??? The chips and other bread is delicious with it, though. 

I forgot the name of the cooking style we got but I believe it had a Cajun feel..? Was delicious with the spinach ravioli and chicken. My bf loves the steak and LOVES the shrimp. 

Get the toffee chocolate option, trust me. It's so damn good. They bring you such yummy berries and shortbread. They also have options to add a pice of cheesecake to dip, so. Stir ally we got it  

5 stars!!
Our visit was the climax to a wonderful eveing out and the staff were so awesome in describing their menu and how it all worked.

My husband and I were celebrating our 16th anniversary and decided to try this establishment.  I'm thrilled we did!!

When I made the reservation- they provided a list of options to make our evening memorable!!  We had a great meal and a great
Great place for a date night! Don't come really hungry. I recommend going for drinks and dessert.
The service was slow and the restaurant is dated. The price and quality of food do not match up. Fun for once but maybe not again.

Prior to arriving to the Melting Pot we made reservations for 4 (the next table was available at 9pm) and had looked at some of their specials. We knew they had a three course option for $30 since it was AZ Restaurant Week and they also had a company special which was endless fondue (which was really just endless entree) for around $37. Half of us were carnivores and opted for this choice, which caused real confusion for our waiter, so we all agreed to just pay the $7 more (not a big deal since we were getting endless shrimp and filet). The cheese course was fine but the salads were small and mediocre. When the salads arrived we had asked for salt, which our waiter never brought. One person in our party had been waiting to enjoy their salad with some salt so it wasn't until another employee dropped our entree broth 10 minutes later that we got the salt. After a lengthy wait,(I believe there was now only one other table in the place), our server came to ask if we would like to order drink refills first before he brought our long anticipated entree....Finally, we received our entree, perhaps adequate for two people, but certainly not four. The waiter did make a good recommendation on the mojo cooking style (but had implied that it was included in the price of the special). After sitting with no food for another 20+ minutes, we were given the dessert menu, I asked about refills on the beef and shrimp. He later returned with 5 shrimp and about 6 bite size portions of beef. Five minutes later, we began our wait again for our next "endless entree" refill. The waiter returned to our table and asked if we would like to take our dessert to go?!! Really?!! Sure, let me just swing past Williams-Sonoma & pick up a fondue set! He seemed a bit shocked when we said no and advised him we had been waiting for more shrimp. We wanted one more refill when he came to the table with another employee following behind us holding our dessert (who then proceeded to turn around in a very disgruntled manner). I would have been more understanding if they had been busy or we had not seen the waitstaff standing idly while we were waiting for food and drink refills. It took 3 hours and $240 to have what you you would normally enjoy in appetizers or at a tapas bar. Again, no complaints on the food quality, but the slow service and lack of refills on both food and drinks made it seem like the most expensive meal, gram for gram, that I have ever eaten. I would have much rather spent it at a nice steak or seafood establishment. The decor is also quite dated and not nearly as "romantic" as I had envisioned. Probably an OK place to take a first date and share an appetizer fondue before going somewhere for a real dinner.

The cheese and dessert courses were very nice but the main courses were disappointing in quality.   Even more disappointing, a mandatory 20% tip for mediocre service.   As empty as the restaurant was, we still couldn't get our servers attention regarding drink orders during the meal nor when we tried to order additional food.   Go for a pre-dinner appetizer or a post-dinner dessert but skip the overpriced main meal and you'll have a better experience.
This place confuses me. Paying an arm and a leg to cook my own food just isn't for me. However I think it could be a nice place to go for dessert and wine.

Try the Love Martini. It is fantastic!

Three starts because it is super pricey. The waitress also thought I was strange because I asked her to not add the mushrooms to the fondue pot. Also, we had a bit of a disagreement when I said we did not have one in North Dakota. She insisted that we did, only to be proven wrong at desert.

Good place for a romantic date, but next time I am going to look for a small less chain like place to eat.

This is the best place for a delcious relaxing meal- we had 7 in our party & had the 4 course meal- had a good variety of cheeses, salads, entrees & dessert- all excellent!
We will be going back!

We had a great experience!  This is a really nice place to go for special occasions.  The booths are so private with the curtains and the service is excellent!  The food is amazing and the experience is unique.

This is the 3rd time I have been to the melting pot before. It was my husbands first time.  I have enjoyed my experiences so I asked my husband to take me there for my birthday. We got there and everything seemed fine. It took a while to get our drinks but we got them and they were OK. When our first course came the vegetables were a little old. They weren't fresh and the bread was hard although the cheese tasted delicious. Our server was a little "green" so to speak (or new). He didn't have the type of experience you would expect when you're paying 100+ dollars for dinner. Before we were even done with our cheese course, the server took all of our plates with veggies still left on them and didn't ask if we were finished. When we got our entrée course, the food was good and we enjoyed that course of the meal. However the server again try to take a plate that had food left on it. We had to tell him that we weren't finished with it yet. When we got our last entrée, the chocolate fondue, our silverware and plates were dirty and we had to ask A busboy to replace them for us. He did and brought us additional plate ware, what his response was "OK" and walked away. Again for the price of the dinner you would expect something a little bit more. The server never came back to apologize or mention anything about the dirty silverware or plates. In addition the staff were in Jeans with sneakers. Which in most situations I'm OK with, however with a type of dinner that you're looking for at a place like this I was assuming something a little bit more classy. The server dropped off the check and told us to take our time and within 3 minutes came back opened the check in front of us and said "is this ready yet?" And clearly we hadn't opened it or even finished our last course. Our experience wasn't horrible but for the price that is why am giving it one star because it wasn't enjoyable. The Decour is outdated and it's not something I would do again for a $160 meal. Spend your money at the capital Grille or something else where you know you're going to get a good experience. I will say the hostess was nice and when my husband made the reservation he had told them it was my birthday. The hostess told me happy birthday and was super friendly. Although when we were seated the server asked us what occasion we were here for which I thought was kind of weird because the hostess had just told me happy birthday.

After my first trip to the Melting Pot, I was in awe over the experience. We started out with a cheese appetizer (which I wasn't in love with), then went for 2 different appetizers, and then the amazing chocolate dessert. The entrees were delicious, but for the small amount of meat actually served, it is extremely overpriced. But, the atmosphere is actually worth the money. The whole restaurant is quiet, perfect for a night of conversation. 

And, back to the dessert. Melted chocolate fondue with all sorts of yummy treats to dip: fruits, cheesecake, marshmallows, brownies, etc, etc. Mmmmmm! Just the dessert, quiet atmosphere, and the bottle of wine had me sold on the evening. 

But, like all others have said, it is very pricey. It was about $140 for 2 of us; including a bottle of wine, an appetizer, 2 entrees, and a dessert plate.

I was very disappointed.  Let me walk you through it:

1) The restaurant it self needs to be updated.  The ambiance and décor was similar to that of a Black Angus.  Just not very classy.  Tables were pretty small too.

2) The service was slightly lacking in the sense I waited about 20 minutes for my cocktail.  Other than that our server was pleasant and patient with me as a first timer

3) I had the Moscato Mule which tasted like soda.  Barely any vodka in my $15 drink.  My friend had the red sangria which was bitter.  I wanted a glass of champagne which they did not offer.  Just a flat super sweet prosecco. 

4)  We started with the Alpine cheese fondue which tasted like pure white wine.  We then switched to the Cheddar fondue which was actually pretty tasty

5) I ordered the Caesar salad which had these weird sweet crunchy things on it which did not compliment the salad at all.  I took a couple of bites and that was enough

6) I ordered the Surf and Turf with the Coq Au Vin cooking style.  The flavor was so bland and disappointing.  For a filet and lobster meal, this fell very short

7) The yin and yang chocolate was our dessert.  The white chocolate portion was delicious.  Best part of the whole night

8) My bill, for just me, was $62 BEFORE tip!  For this kind of money I expect to be wowed not underwhelmed which is exactly what I was 

9) After all of this, I ended my night on the toilet!  My stomach was so upset from this!  Maybe this was TMI but seriously!

Melting pot is nestled away here in ahwatukee and great for locals in the area. We came in for a birthday party where if you sign up for a promo they will give you free chocolate covered strawberries. 

The wait staff was very nice and cordial, the food was good too, but you'll have to consider that there is a very long wait between courses and this meal took us 3 hrs and 15 minutes on a Tuesday night....

We had the four course experience tonight and we even had our four year old with us. The food was great. The service was exceptional. Our waiter (Clayton) was very attentive and made our experience really great. The manager came by to ensure that everything was good and we had no complaints. Definitely recommend this one!!

My husband and I took the family in tonight. Our own 4 teens and a friend of one of our sons visiting from CA. We had a super experience. The food was as always great but most importantly, our service by CJ our waiter was so impressive. Such good customer service! Thank you for the good evening!

We came here for my wife's Birthday.  It was my first experience at The Melting Pot and it was a great one.  We were greeted upon walking in and seated right away.  They seated us in a small private booth for two which was very nice.  Each of the booths has a curtain that they pull shut so you feel like you are all alone.  There was only a "dull roar" from the other guests in the restaurant, so it was very nice.  

Our server was excellent.  She was outgoing and very helpful in explaining the menu.  We got the cheese and chocolate fondue with a salad.  All three courses were great.  We had the cheddar fondue which you can't go wrong with.  The different varieties of bread that we dipped in the fondue with delicious. My wife and I both got the house salad, hers with ranch and I got mine with the house dressing.  My dressing was sweet and the salad was very good. I would probably try it with ranch next time as ranch is my go-to dressing.  We finished off with the chocolate fondue which was amazing.  It had strawberries, rice-crispy treats, marshmallows, etc.  Dessert was the best course of the meal.  

It was a little on the pricey side for us, but a great choice for special occasions and well worth it!  It may be my choice for my Birthday dinner later this year :)

Paul Fratella (General Manager of Melting Pot) knows the meaning of extraordinary customer care.  I took today off from work to take my daughter, who had always wanted try fondue, to Shabu Fondue (they are the closest to our home).  Their website said they were open as of 11 a.m. M-F.  My daughter was so disappointed when we arrived to see that they were closed.  My heart sank.  I called The Melting Pot in Ahwatukee & Paul stated they didn't open until 5 p.m.  We had to pick up my other daughter by 5:30 p.m.  We were so bummed that our special fondue day wasn't going to happen.  Paul sensed the disappointment in my voice and kindly offered to open his doors for us to enjoy lunch.  I was shocked.  My daughter looked as though we had won free tickets to Disneyland.  The rest of the experience just got better & better.  Paul, the General Manager, served us and made us feel special.  It was thrilling to see a big smile on my daughter's face.  Paul transformed our dismal day into a dynamic one.  The food was delicious (fresh, flavorful and filling) and the variety was incredible.  To top it off, they took a picture of us & framed it in a Melting Pot silver frame.  We were impressed and WILL be back!

Our server Alexandra was excellent! Service is quick, friendly and helpful. :) it's nice to have a dining experience that is vegetarian friendly and where you leave full afterwards! Thanks melting pot for a wonderful date night.

Been here twice now, always a good time. Food is good and wait staff is too. The price is what really gets me. $236 for 6 people, that should at least include free drinks, right? Wrong, still paid for them. 

Because of the extremely high cost, its not a place we can go to often by any means.

A nice date night. Thank you living social.  This was my 1st time eating here. 

Food and service was good overall.  I wish the seating was a little more private. Booth seating with people all around is not exactly quaint.  I would go back with another Living Social deal, but would not go and pay full price.

So, I came here with a voucher for a 3-course meal for 2 plus a champagne toast which was a good deal, but about all I'd pay for the food we got. If you don't have the living social voucher, I'd spend your money elsewhere.

The quality of the food is just OK. Besides the meat, which was delicious, but served in very small portions, it was substandard, especially for the price. (our total would have been over $100 if we didn't have that voucher).

It might just be because I'm allergic to wheat, shrimp and apples, but I couldn't eat half the things they brought us.

Also, when our main course came out, with raw meat just sitting there, our waiter said he'd be right back with the cooking times ... he brought them crudely scribbled on what looked like a used napkin which I thought was kind of unprofessional of the restaurant.

Finally, at the end of our meal, the manager came over and asked if we wanted to donate $10 to St. Jude's children's hospital and we'd get a $20 gift card. I thought, heck why not? It's basically getting $10 for free. So, I did the donation..... but when I received the card, I realized it wasn't a gift card at all - it was a $20 off coupon for spending $50 next time at The Melting Pot. I definitely felt  misled.

Overall, subpar. 3 stars is pretty generous ... I'll give it to them for ambience and because my boyfriend loved it.

We went for happy hour yesterday after reading some reviews.  With only 15 seats for happy hour, we thought we'd have to get there early, but NO ONE WAS THERE.  The bar tender said it RARELY fills up!  Shocker!  With good drink deals ($5 martinis, $6 wines, and good beer deals) as well as $4 fondue for cheese or chocolate, this really is a great first date place.  yes, the date would have to be early, but you could easily catch a movie afterward

The Melting Pot is not just a restaurant, it's a dining experience. Expect it to take 2-3 hours, so make sure you enjoy your company!

My husband took me here for Valentines day (my review is belated) and it was nothing short of amazing. The service was friendly, but not annoyingly so, and it felt really private and relaxing. The food was delicious and plentiful. I can't imagine how someone could think otherwise honestly. It's a 4 course meal. We had PLENTY of food left over and we were stuffed. 

I would highly recommend this place for a night out with your SO, a double date, a girls night, or anything else slightly festive. Dinner after work with the family? Not so much.

My boyfriend and I came for our one year anniversary and boy was I surprised! I've always wanted to come to the Melting Pot but I never had a reason to spend so much money on Fondue!

When we got to the restaurant we were quickly seated in this secluded booth that was tucked away in the wall, then they closed a curtain in front of our booth and it was completely private! I thought that was so much fun!

Our servers name was Dan and he was great, very attentive and he walked us through the menu, (which was a little overwhelming), and made helpful suggestions.

We ended up doing the four course meal which came to like $90 dollars and it was SO GOOD. We started with what Dan suggested, the Spinach and Artichoke cheese dip which was served with granny smith apples, various breads and veggies. Dan made it right at our table which was great too!  When we took our first bite we were both immediately "wowed".  Then after that we both got our own house salad, the house dressing was great. When our main course came we chose our broth to cook our meat in and the meat we got was lobster tail, shrimp, pork, buffalo chicken, mushrooms in noodles (dumpling like) and beef. They were served with various sauces which I liked. Then last but not least, desert! YUM!! We decided on Bananas Foster and omg so great! The pound cake and brownies it came with was so good. I may have to come back just to get some more desert at some point! lol.
